intro: Pilosella cinereiformis, commonly known as the grayleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, grayish-green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Pilosella cinereiformis is often found in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
